The claim states that the stimulus bill: including funding for traffic lights in China.
The expert: s verdict examines the source of the claim, which is a Pittsburgh Tribune-Review article titled "Stimulus money pays for street, traffic lights made largely overseas."
The expert investigates the visuals used: which show the words "Stimulus money pays for street, traffic lights …" and "in China …" appearing on the screen over an image of a traffic light layered with the colors of the Chinese flag.
The expert mentions that the ad: s claim could be heard another way, suggesting that the lights were built in China for American streets.
